name: places/ChIJoSls_LpZwokRxMnQAcIyE0w
formattedAddress: 259 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 259 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Horrible customer service. My phone bricked. When contacting Google Support, they said to go to Ubreakifix and that the initial diagnosis was free. Even went online to schedule an appointment and saw that the initial diagnosis was free. Decided to walk-in on 01/30/2024 afternoon instead. The rep asked $20 for initial diagnosis. Pointed out that google said it was free and their own website said it was free too. This Latino looking guy says "we are not google" and refuses until the $20 is paid. I'd have tipped after the repair, I do appreciate their work, but this guy wanted to rip $20 off me from the start, so I left.

I'd have tipped after the repair, I do appreciate their work, but this guy wanted to rip $20 off me from the start, so I left.

originalText.text: I went here to get a console fixed and right when I walked in they told me what was wrong with it. They said they were backed up and it might take around 2 weeks. They also said since they did a brief diagnostic (looking at it for 10 seconds) that if there is something else wrong with it they are going to add it to my bill. Including the $60 ‘detailed diagnostic’. After maybe 4 days they called me and told me it was ready for pickup. I checked store hours and it said 10-7(that was yesterday) and I assumed it went for today too. I went to the store at around 10:30 and it was closed. I checked online again and it said it was open from 12AM(keep in mind AM) until 5PM. It is now 12:30 and I have been calling them. I knew it was their mistake putting their hours online for 12AM and assumed it was just meant for noon. After calling the store 3 times with no answer, I had to call 2 other stores to find out it was closed. Yesterday when they called me, they told me to come in at any time. Fix your hours online and get better service. Definitely not gonna come back here.

originalText.text: I received repair services at the w 39th Street location and am VERY dissatisfied! I have a HP 360 laptop and the screen came apart. I took it to be repaired and was giving a screen that does not detect my stylus pen. In this generation of technology, I find it hard to believe when multiple electronics come with stylus pens. If that is the case, then that is something  the consumer should know from the beginning before deciding to do business with your company. Now I’m stuck with a low grade screen that doesn’t allow me the functionality I had prior to coming to this company. Also, the manager and follow up timing at that location is HORRIBLE, and not consistent.

originalText.text:
Well, a good experience turned sour. Came in for a cracked screen repair. Everything went well but when I left the speaker was now staticy and crackly when it was working fine even with a cracked screen. I called them a few hours after my initial visit and was kindly told to come in. A wasted train ride the next day because I was told that my speaker was damaged before the screen repair and that to look at it would be a new service ticket. The difference in empathy and continuity was like night and day.

I used too much force upon leaving and accidentally made a loud noise in their door which I apologize for.

originalText.text: I have come here for phone repairs twice over the past few years, a battery replacement and a cracked screen repair. In both cases, repairs happened the same day and prices were reasonable. Thank you!
